intro: Daphnandra micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daphnandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring elliptical leaves with a glossy, dark green upper surface. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and role within the diverse flora of Madagascar.
